title.narrative: Provision of emergency shelter and cash NFI for drought-affected IDPs in Herat and Badghis provinces

description.narrative:
The project targets severely drought-affected populations in Badghis and Herat provinces through provision of emergency shelter kits and cash for NFI. The project is based on rigorous needs assessments performed directly by CRDSA protection monitoring teams in coordination with provincial ANDMAs and DRRD and is informed by insights and results from Afghanistan Intercluster Drought Impact and Needs Assessments (DINA-led by UNOCHA) for Herat, and Badghis province and Herat Drought IDP Assessment -HAP (conducted by IOM) as well as NRC Protection mission. The project entails 2 components including (1) emergency shelter kits assistance and (2) provision of cash for NFI. Both components together will provide benefits to a total of 13650 individuals (1950 drought affected families - including 3412 men, 2594 women, 3958 boys, 3686 girls) in Muqur district of Badghis and Injil district of Herat province.
In component (1) emergency shelters kits CRDSA will provide 900 emergency shelter kits to 6300 people (900 drought affected families - 1575 men, 1197 women, 1827 boys and 1701 girls) in Sanjetak amp Chakarha informal IDP camp in Moqur district of Badghis province.
In component (2) cash for NFI will be provided to 3850 individuals (550 drought affected families - including 962 men, 732 women, 1116 boys and 1040 girls) in Sanjetak amp Chakarha informal IDP camp in Moqur district of Badghis province and 3500 individuals (500 drought affected families - including 875 men, 665 women, 1015 boys and 945 girls) in Pediatric Hospital IDP settlement area in Injil district of Herat province. Totally in component (2) 7350 individuals (1050 drought affected families - including 1836 men, 1397 women, 2132 boys, 1985 girls) will be covered under the cash for NFI emergency services in Badghis and Herat province.
The modality of beneficiary selection includes a two-step process in which in the first step beneficiaries were identified using the data collected using modified HEAT questionnaire (for drought) as part of the Intercluster Drought Needs and Impact Assessment led by UOCHA (where CRDSA was also a member in conduct of the assessment). In the second step, the identified beneficiaries were then further surveyed using the CRDSA/UNCHR Protection Monitoring Checklist. Specific beneficiary selection criteria will be applied during the implementation of the project. These criteria for emergency shelter kits beneficiaries include elderly headed families, female headed families, child headed families/families with child laborer, families with acute/chronic patients, families having new born infants and more than 3 children under 5 years old and the criteria NFI assistance include the ones for emergency shelter kits plus families lacking/shortage of blankets, lack/shortage of cooking tools, shortage of basic clothing.
